Trial_Design.evidence: Patients undergoing elective aortic surgery requiring cardiopulmonary bypass were randomly assigned to receive FCH or placebo.

Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing elective aortic surgery requiring cardiopulmonary bypass were randomly assigned to receive FCH or placebo.

Intervention.evidence: Patients undergoing elective aortic surgery requiring cardiopulmonary bypass were randomly assigned to receive FCH or placebo.

Method_Outcome.evidence: More allogeneic blood product units were administered during the first 24 h after FCH, 5.0 (2.0–11.0), when compared with placebo, 3.0 (0.0–7.0), P =0.026.

Result_Outcome.evidence: More allogeneic blood product units were administered during the first 24 h after FCH, 5.0 (2.0–11.0), when compared with placebo, 3.0 (0.0–7.0), P =0.026.

Harms.evidence: Adverse event rates were comparable in each group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Clinical trial registration: ClinicalTrials.gov identifier no. NCT01475669 ; EudraCT trial no. 2011-002685-20.
